artist: Artist: Wenceslaus Hollar; Artist: After a follower of Hans Holbein the Younger
creditline: Gift of Elizabeth, Julie, and Catherine Andrus in memory of John and Marion Andrus
description: interior scene with Christ bound with ropes at LL; man on throne in back at R addressing Christ and his captors; one of the men next to Christ holds up a book
inscription:
Inscription

inscribed in plate: [To ANNAS heere they bring him and they beate him / With Bookes, and vildlie everie waie entreate him, / For why their Bookes his truth (the truth) disgrace / As bad as blowes or spitting in his face.]

numbered in plate at lower right: [4]
provenance: John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn.; by descent to his daughters, Elizabeth, Katie, and Julie; gave to MIA, 2015. Earlier provenances have been gathered, but further research will increase our knowledge of their histories.
title: Christ before Annas, From the Satirical Passion
